rows.title: Day One: Module Reminder

text.eng: Good day! This is a reminder that the first MaPa Chat module will start [SET TIME] later. I'm excited to start the program with you! We'll start building a Happy Home with a simple yet effective tip: doing One-on-One Time. You will see what it can do for your family! Let's meet!

guidance.eng: Replace [SET Time] with your session time before sending the message.

rows.text: Good day! This is a reminder that the first MaPa Chat module will start [SET TIME] later. I'm excited to start the program with you! We'll start building a Happy Home with a simple yet effective tip: doing One-on-One Time. You will see what it can do for your family! Let's meet!
rows.guidance: Replace [SET Time] with your session time before sending the message.

rows.title: After the Session: Thanking Participants and Reminding Them to Practise

title.eng: After the Session: Thanking Participants and Reminding Them to Practise

text.eng: Hello! Thank you for attending our session! Remember, our main activity this week is One-on-One Time with your child. Even just 5 minutes can go a long way! You can do this!

rows.text: Hello! Thank you for attending our session! Remember, our main activity this week is One-on-One Time with your child. Even just 5 minutes can go a long way! You can do this!

rows.title: Day Three: Support Reminder

text.eng:
Hi! How is your practice of the homework assignment going? I understand that
you may have some challenges with this module. Feel free to text me if you have any questions.Thank you!

rows.text:
Hi! How is your practice of the homework assignment going? I understand that
you may have some challenges with this module. Feel free to text me if you have any questions.Thank you!

rows.title:
One Day Before the Next Online Session: Reminder for
the Next Session

title.eng:
One Day Before the Next Online Session: Reminder for
the Next Session

text.eng:
Good morning! We've reached the end of the week.
How is One-on-One Time with your children?
Share your successes and challenges! Feel free to be creative in sharing: send stories, voice messages, or pictures. I'd love to hear how your week was at our next session on [INSERT DATE HERE].

guidance.eng: Insert the date for the next session before sending the message

rows.title: Day One: Module Reminder

text.eng: It's  been  a  whole  week!  Our  next  chat  session  is  [SET  TIME]  later.  We'll  talk  about  the  benefits  of  talking  about  feelings  with  your  child‚Äîand  add  a  second  foundation  to  the  walls  of  our  Happy  Home.  Let's  chat!

guidance.eng: Replace [SET Time] with your session time, then send the message along with this image

rows.title: Message 1: Greetings

text.eng: Greetings  and  Greetings Welcome  to  Module  2  of  our  MaPaChat!  How  are  you  all?  Are  you  happy? Stressed?  Angry?  Annoyed?  Calm?  Whatever  emotion  you  are  feeling feeling...it's  okay!  Let's  type  what  we're  feeling today

guidance.eng: Give parents a moment to share how they feel. Also, share your own feelings. For example, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy to be part of our MaPaChat session today

rows.text: Greetings  and  Greetings Welcome  to  Module  2  of  our  MaPaChat!  How  are  you  all?  Are  you  happy? Stressed?  Angry?  Annoyed?  Calm?  Whatever  emotion  you  are  feeling feeling...it's  okay!  Let's  type  what  we're  feeling today

rows.title: Message 2: Discussion about Home Activity

text.eng: Last week,  we  talked  about  One-on-One  Time. with  the  child.  Today,  we  will  look  at  one  of  the  other  ways  of using  One-on-One  Time‚Äîtalking  about  feelings with  the  child.  But  first,  let's  chat  about  your  home  activities or  homework.  How  is  your  One-on-One  Time  going?

guidance.eng: Accept the experience that parents will share.

text.eng: One  of  the  successes  you  shared  last  week. You  did  One-on-One  Time  and  [describe  the  success]. You  did  a  great  job  [attributing  success  to]building block].

guidance.eng: Share a success from what the parents have shared.

rows.title: Message 4: Discuss Challenge

text.eng: Now  we  will  discuss  a  shared  challenge  about  [describe  the  challenge  from  the  feedback  module].

guidance.eng: If no one shared a challenge last week, send the example challenges one by one in the chat below.

rows.text: Now  we  will  discuss  a  shared  challenge  about  [describe  the  challenge  from  the  feedback  module].
rows.guidance: If no one shared a challenge last week, send the example challenges one by one in the chat below.

rows.title: Message 5: Discussion about challenge & solution

text.eng: Can  we  work  together  to  come  up  with  a  positive  solution  to  [describe  the  challenge]?  What  might  a  parent  in  that  situation  do?

guidance.eng: Encourage parents to think of positive solutions. Here are some examples of challenges and solutions:

rows.title: Message ??

text.eng: Thank  you  so  much  for  your  ideas.  Now  that  you  know  how  to  use  One-on-One  Time  with  your  child,  you  can  also  try  it  with  other  members  of  your  family‚Äîlike  your  spouse,  parents,  in-laws,  or  even  grandchildren!

rows.text: Thank  you  so  much  for  your  ideas.  Now  that  you  know  how  to  use  One-on-One  Time  with  your  child,  you  can  also  try  it  with  other  members  of  your  family‚Äîlike  your  spouse,  parents,  in-laws,  or  even  grandchildren!

rows.title: Message 6: Introducing MaPa Skill

text.eng:
Today  we're  going  to  talk  about  MaPa  Skill:  helping  children  manage  their  emotions.  Here  are  five  foundations  for  talking  to  children  about  emotions. 
1.  BREATHE  -  Breathe  before  you  start  to  calm  yourself  down. 
2.  SHARE  -  Share  your  feelings. 
3.  LISTEN  -  Listen  to  your  child  or  teenager. 
4.  PAINFUL  -  Concerned  for  them. 
5.  FIND  -  Find  the  positive

rows.text:
Today  we're  going  to  talk  about  MaPa  Skill:  helping  children  manage  their  emotions.  Here  are  five  foundations  for  talking  to  children  about  emotions. 
1.  BREATHE  -  Breathe  before  you  start  to  calm  yourself  down. 
2.  SHARE  -  Share  your  feelings. 
3.  LISTEN  -  Listen  to  your  child  or  teenager. 
4.  PAINFUL  -  Concerned  for  them. 
5.  FIND  -  Find  the  positive

rows.title: Message 7: Comic about young child

text.eng: Here is a comic showing how a child talked about their feelings with their grandmother during One-on-One Time.

text.eng: How  did  you  see  any  of  the  five  foundations  of  Talking  About  Feelings  in  this  comic?

guidance.eng: Give parents time to answer before moving on to the comic

rows.title: Message 9: Comic about a Teenage Child: Talking about Feelings

text.eng: Here's another comic where Dad Jose talks about difficult emotions with his teenage son, Pablo

rows.title: Message 10: Discussion about Comics

text.eng:
Let's also chat about this comic. What did you notice about how Tatay Jose spoke to his son?
Which of the foundations did you see?

guidance.eng: Give parents a chance to answer the first question before moving onto the next question

rows.text:
Let's also chat about this comic. What did you notice about how Tatay Jose spoke to his son?
Which of the foundations did you see?

rows.title: Message 11: Discussion about Comics: Think about the Age of the Child

title.eng: Message 11: Discussion about Comics: Think about the Age of the Child

text.eng:
How would the story in the comic change if Dad was talking about his feelings to a young child
instead of a teenager?

guidance.eng: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.text:
How would the story in the comic change if Dad was talking about his feelings to a young child
instead of a teenager?
rows.guidance: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.title: Message 12: Discussion about Reasons for Talking About Feelings

title.eng: Message 12: Discussion about Reasons for Talking About Feelings

text.eng: Why is it helpful to encourage a young child or teenager to share their feelings?

guidance.eng: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.text: Why is it helpful to encourage a young child or teenager to share their feelings?
rows.guidance: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.title: Message 13: Setting a Home Activity

text.eng:
Thank you for sharing your ideas. For this week's homework, practice talking about feelings with your child during your One-on-One time and at other times.
Also try to pay attention to your own feelings as your day goes by.

rows.text:
Thank you for sharing your ideas. For this week's homework, practice talking about feelings with your child during your One-on-One time and at other times.
Also try to pay attention to your own feelings as your day goes by.

rows.title: Message 14: Clarification

text.eng: Do you have any more questions about talking about feelings?

guidance.eng: Allow a few minutes for parents to ask questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions. Before you give your own answer, give the group a chance to think about it and respond by saying "That's a good question! What do others think could be an answer or solution to that?"

rows.text: Do you have any more questions about talking about feelings?
rows.guidance: Allow a few minutes for parents to ask questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions. Before you give your own answer, give the group a chance to think about it and respond by saying "That's a good question! What do others think could be an answer or solution to that?"

rows.title: Message 16 ‚Äì Audio: Pause for a Moment

title.eng: Message 16 ‚Äì Audio: Pause for a Moment

text.eng:
Before we end today's chat session, we will do a Pause for a Moment.
Remember that you can also do this if you feel like it.
stress.

Before we end today's chat session, we will do a Pause for a Moment.

stress.

rows.title: Message 17 ‚Äì Gratitude

text.eng:
Thank you. What you did today was difficult but also very important. It will help you manage
your stress and give your child the skills to manage their stress. Have a great day!

rows.text:
Thank you. What you did today was difficult but also very important. It will help you manage
your stress and give your child the skills to manage their stress. Have a great day!

rows.title: Day Three: Reminder to Practise

text.eng:
Hello! Remember that the main activity for this week is to talk about feelings in your One-on-One time and at
other times. Talking about
feelings isn‚Äôt easy at first‚Äì especially if it‚Äôs new to you and your child‚Äì so remember to practice.
Good job on your attempt!

rows.text:
Hello! Remember that the main activity for this week is to talk about feelings in your One-on-One time and at
other times. Talking about
feelings isn‚Äôt easy at first‚Äì especially if it‚Äôs new to you and your child‚Äì so remember to practice.
Good job on your attempt!

rows.title: Day Five: Feedback

text.eng:
Hi! Could you share something positive that happened when you talked to your child about feelings?
Have you experienced any challenges while trying to do this? Could be creative!
Send stories, voice messages, and pictures. I'd love to hear how your week was when we
meet again on [INSERT DATE HERE].

guidance.eng: Accept submissions by parents for giving thumbs up, emoji, or compliments. Be sure to pick up one or two successes and challenges that can be discussed at the beginning of the next module.

rows.title: Message 1: Welcome and Check-in

text.eng:
Hello, everyone! üòÉ

Welcome to our final chat session! 

Today, we are wrapping up our conversation about building blocks for mental wellbeing. So far, we‚Äôve identified the relationship between thoughts, feelings, and behaviours, learned about positive self talk, and relying on our character strengths. Great job!

Congratulations on completing the Crianza con Conciencia+ Programme! You can continue to complete the course on the CC+.

‚ú® Take a moment to think back to the beginning of the programme. You should be so proud of yourself. How was your experience in Crianza con Conciencia+?

guidance.eng: Allow caregivers to share their experience during the programme. You can give brief words of encouragement like ‚ÄúWonderful!‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am happy to hear that!‚Äù or even share celebration emojis like üéâ or ‚≠ê.

rows.text:
Hello, everyone! üòÉ

Welcome to our final chat session! 

Today, we are wrapping up our conversation about building blocks for mental wellbeing. So far, we‚Äôve identified the relationship between thoughts, feelings, and behaviours, learned about positive self talk, and relying on our character strengths. Great job!

Congratulations on completing the Crianza con Conciencia+ Programme! You can continue to complete the course on the CC+.

‚ú® Take a moment to think back to the beginning of the programme. You should be so proud of yourself. How was your experience in Crianza con Conciencia+?
rows.guidance: Allow caregivers to share their experience during the programme. You can give brief words of encouragement like ‚ÄúWonderful!‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am happy to hear that!‚Äù or even share celebration emojis like üéâ or ‚≠ê.

rows.title: Message 2: Pleasant time with your girl, boy or teen

title.eng: Message 2: Pleasant time with your girl, boy or teen

text.eng:
Thank you for sharing your experiences. 

Now, let‚Äôs think back to a time when you and your girl, boy or teen did something together that made you feel really good. 

How did it make you feel? Did it make you feel joy, love, pride or inspired? What were you doing? 

If you feel comfortable, you can tell us about it in the chat. We would love to hear your story!

guidance.eng:
Allow time for caregivers to share stories. If needed, feel free to share an example: 

My teen and I cooked dinner together, and we had such a great time. I felt so joyful doing a fun activity together. He is learning all the best recipes from me:).

rows.text:

rows.title: Message 3: Pleasant emotions

text.eng:
Thank you for sharing! 

We all experience pleasant emotions throughout our lives, but did you know that you can boost your well-being by boosting pleasant emotions and thoughts? This works for you and your child or teen! 

Some ways we have talked about in our chat sessions are: 
Thinking of three good things that happened during the day. 
Remember our chat last time about positive qualities? You and your girl, boy or teen could do activities together that brings out the positive qualities in both of you. 
When you feel pleasant emotions and share it with your girl, boy, or teen, they feel it too! 

When your well-being needs a boost, start by trying these activities. 

Which of these do you think you can continue doing even after the programme has ended?

guidance.eng: Allow caregivers to respond. You can reply to the parents with an emoji ‚≠ê or words of encouragement, like ‚ÄúThat sounds great!‚Äù or ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, you can always plan to try it later this week.‚Äù

rows.title: Message 4: Three Good Things and Group Admin

title.eng: Message 4: Three Good Things and Group Admin

text.eng:
Thank you for sharing. üèÖ

Before we close, let‚Äôs share our three good things from this week all together.  

Remember, they can be personal, work-related, or family-related. The more detailed, the better! You can keep this up after I leave the WhatsApp Group.

Although this is my last chat session with you, you are in good hands with your new chat group admin: [INSERT NAMES OF MODERATORS] üíô

rows.title: Message 5: Goodbye

text.eng:
It's been wonderful being part of this amazing parent program with all of you! Saying goodbye makes me a bit sad. 

As I shared with you during the onboarding session, I will now be exiting this WhatsApp Group. üëã

You are the best parents to your girls, boys and teens.  *You can still complete your final Crianza con Conciencia+ lessons if you have not done so yet*. üå±

We all face difficult situations sometimes, and these final parts of @global.programme_name will help you and your girl, boy or teen to get through them well. 

You‚Äôve got this! ‚≠êYou are doing a wonderful job as a caregiver. It has been a pleasure to be on this journey with you!
